titleStmt.title: Letter from John G. Neihardt to Enid Neihardt, June 30, 1935
titleStmt.author: Neihardt, John G.

publicationStmt.authority: The Papers of John G. Neihardt

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Letter from John G. Neihardt to Enid Neihardt, June 30, 1935

msIdentifier.repository: John G. Neihardt Center Research Library, Aly Collection

div1.p: I know you are doing every-thing right, and I'm not even thinking about it. Yes, I told them to get the needed groceries in addition to the five. Yes, pay up the bills. You'll be crowded until the June bills are paid; then it will be easier. I don't need money now - may not need any Am getting on finely. Will send stuff to P-D this Wed., & am askign for 2 wks. vacation after that. O how I hope we can make that trip together. I think we can, unless your prospects work out in a job. It would be fun dictating a pronebook to you

maybe two books! Mama has told you we are staying here another week. Weather is pleasant - very. Act. nearly 1600 & no damp heat. We must not go south just yet., Sway finish Messiah this coming week. Very close. Held up this morning; but had two good mornings before today. Endless love Dad Enot, please mail me the two pieces of the fork I'm making, also a piece of Sadisan Steel from the shop. Hiddy will find (inside

the in a can on the north end of my work bench. It's the piece with one end used for a welding. The two pieces of the fork are in my desk drawer with the paper, I can have electric welding done here. An inch long piece of the Saidson steel would be sufficient & Dave postage; but I'm afraid Hiddy couldn't find a good back saw blade to cut it.
